title: Playboy Magazine Founder Hugh Hefner Dies At 91
description:
(28 Sep 2017) Playboy founder Hugh Hefner has died at the age of 91.
For decades hefner was the pipe-smoking, silk-pajama-wearing center of a constant party with celebrities and Playboy models. 
SOUNDBITE (English) Hugh Hefner, Playboy Founder
"It takes a special event to get me out of my pajamas."
He was known worldwide as the hedonist who revved up the sexual revolution in the 1950s and built a multimedia empire symbolized by bow-tied women in bunny costumes.
Hefner published the first issue of Playboy in 1953, featuring naked photos of Marilyn Monroe.
SOUNDBITE (English) Hugh Hefner, Playboy Founder
"Well, I remember, you know, with great fondness the beginnings of it all. The day in which I held the first issue of the magazine I realized that I was going to be in the busines a while. Because I started the magazine in 1950 with no money."
In 2015, Playboy stopped publishing images of naked women, citing the proliferation of nudity on the internet.
A Playboy statement said Hefner died of natural causes at his home surrounded by family on Wednesday night.
PETER BANDA , THE ASSOCIATED PRESS.


You can license this story through AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/metadata/youtube/55f02bc9ce87d9372ca84e35e17eb31a 
Find out more about AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/HowWeWork
